transportAdvice: Melbourne has an extensive public transit network including trams, trains, and buses that cover the CBD and most tourist areas well, with the tram network being particularly useful for inner-city travel. Taxis and ride-share vehicles are widely available, and the city centre is walkable, though distances between some attractions may warrant using transit.

weather.description: Hot summer month with occasional heatwaves and unpredictable afternoon storms; pack light clothing and sun protection.
Similar to January with warm, sometimes very hot days and Melbourne's famously changeable weather patterns.
Late summer transitioning to autumn, with more settled temperatures and slightly increased rainfall.
Mild and pleasant autumn weather with cooler evenings; a good time to visit with comfortable sightseeing conditions.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent rain; layers are recommended as temperatures drop significantly after dark.
Cool, wet winter month with short days; indoor attractions and Melbourne's caf√© culture come into their own.
The coldest month of the year with regular rain and overcast skies; warm clothing is essential.
Still cold and wet but days begin to lengthen slightly; expect grey skies and frequent showers.
Early spring brings warming temperatures but highly variable weather, with sunny days and cold snaps possible.
Spring is in full swing with pleasant temperatures, blooming gardens, and the occasional warm day mixed with showers.
Warming late spring weather with longer days; one of the more enjoyable months to visit despite some rainfall.
Early summer with warm to hot days, festive atmosphere, and the return of Melbourne's unpredictable afternoon storms.
